What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: You cover a ridiculous amount of material in this course so you really feel like you've learned a lot by the end. Perhaps a bit heavier on the conceptual side than the quantitative side (which I enjoyed thoroughly).
a better understanding of inferring properties of star clusters and galaxies
This class restored my love of astrophysics.

I learned about galaxy formation and the research methods we use to study galaxies. There wasn't any coding. We did all our PSETs by hand, which helped me grasp the models and concepts better I think.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Small class size so the prof. really interacts with everyone. Material is interesting and Psets are not Too hard. Only one midterm and a final which is nice.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes if you're really interested in astronomy and have solid physics/math background.

I would absolutely recommend this to another student. Through taking this class, you can learn an incredible amount about galaxies and space (most of which are absolutely awesome). Prof K is a bit awkward, but it is in a sweet, charming way. He is a great lecturer and actually takes an interest in his student's success. I would recommend this but with this caveat: If you haven't taken a decent amount of astro or physics classes recently, it may be a tad difficult. This is due to the fact that there is a lot of information to absorb, and if you are hung up in the math or physics of it, it can really snowball on you. If you have some physics (even just 180/181), some basic multi-variable calc and (possibly) some astro (210 probably), then by all means take this class. You wont regret it.
